alert.note: Alert for Brown; Nicollet; Redwood; Renville; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:17AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sibley, east central Redwood, central Brown, southeastern Renville and northwestern Nicollet Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 617 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Sleepy Eye, or 16 miles west of New Ulm, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairfax around 630 AM CDT. Gibbon around 635 AM CDT. This includes U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 80 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for south central, central and southwestern Minnesota.
